020
021import net.tnemc.item.AbstractItemStack;
022import net.tnemc.item.providers.CalculationsProvider;
023import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.helper.CraftingRecipe;
024import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.scheduler.SchedulerProvider;
025import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
026import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
027import revxrsal.commands.command.CommandActor;
028
029import java.io.InputStream;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import java.util.UUID;
032import java.util.regex.Pattern;
033
034/**
035 * Acts like a bridge between various server software and classes specific to each
036 * server software such as opening menus, and sending messages.
037 *
038 * @since 0.1.2.0
039 * @author creatorfromhell
040 */
041public interface ServerConnector {
042
043  /**
044   * The name of this implementation.
045   * @return The name of the implementation.
046   */
047  String name();
048
049  /**
050   * Used to replace placeholders from a string.
051   * @param player The player to use for the placeholder replacement.
052   * @param message The message to replace placeholders in.
053   * @return The string after placeholders have been replaced.
054   */
055  String replacePlaceholder(final UUID player, final String message);
056
057  /**
058   * The proxy provider to use for this implementation.
059   * @return The proxy provider to use for this implementation.
060   */
061  ProxyProvider proxy();
062
063  /**
064   * Used to convert an {@link CommandActor} to a {@link CmdSource}.
065   * @return The {@link CmdSource} for this actor.
066   */
067  CmdSource<?> source(@NotNull CommandActor actor);
068
069  /**
070   * Used to get the amount of online players.
071   * @return The amount of online players.
072   */
073  int onlinePlayers();
074
075  /**
076   * Attempts to find a {@link PlayerProvider player} based on an {@link UUID identifier}.
077   * @param identifier The identifier
078   * @return An Optional containing the located {@link PlayerProvider player}, or an empty
079   * Optional if no player is located.
080   */
081  Optional<PlayerProvider> findPlayer(@NotNull UUID identifier);
082
083  /**
084   * This is used to return an instance of an {@link PlayerProvider player} based on the provided
085   * instance's player object.
086   * @param player The instance of the player.
087   * @return The initialized {@link PlayerProvider player object}.
088   */
089  PlayerProvider initializePlayer(@NotNull Object player);
090
091  /**
092   * Used to get a cached UUID based on a username.
093   * @param name The name to use for the check.
094   * @return The UUID from the cached player. If no data with the player name exists, this will not
095   * check the MojangAPI, it'll instead generate a random UUID.
096   */
097  default UUID getCached(final String name) {
098    return UUID.randomUUID();
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Used to determine if this player has played on this server before.
103   *
104   * @param uuid The {@link UUID} that is associated with the player.
105   * @return True if the player has played on the server before, otherwise false.
106   */
107  boolean playedBefore(UUID uuid);
108
109  /**
110   * Used to determine if a player with the specified username has played
111   * before.
112   * @param name The username to search for.
113   * @return True if someone with the specified username has played before,
114   * otherwise false.
115   */
116  boolean playedBefore(final String name);
117
118  /**
119   * Used to determine if a player with the specified username is online.
120   * @param name The username to search for.
121   * @return True if someone with the specified username is online.
122   */
123  boolean online(final String name);
124
125  /**
126   * Used to locate a UUID for a specific name. This could be called from either a primary or secondary thread, and
127   * should not call back to the Mojang API ever.
128   * @param name The name to use for the search.
129   * @return An optional containing the UUId if exists, otherwise false.
130   */
131  Optional<UUID> fromName(final String name);
132
133  /**
134   * Used to locate a username for a specific name. This could be called from either a primary or secondary thread, and
135   * should not call back to the Mojang API ever.
136   * @param id The {@link UUID} to use for the search.
137   * @return An optional containing the name if exists, otherwise false.
138   */
139  Optional<String> fromID(final UUID id);
140
141  /**
142   * Returns the {@link Pattern pattern} utilized to determine if a string is a valid
143   * player username.
144   *
145   * @return The {@link Pattern pattern} to use for determining if a string is a valid
146   * player username.
147   *
148   * @see Pattern
149   */
150  default Pattern playerMatcher() {
151    return Pattern.compile("^\\w*$");
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Returns the name of the default world.
156   *
157   * @return The name of the default world.
158   */
159  String defaultWorld();
160
161  /**
162   * Determines if a plugin with the correlating name is currently installed.
163   *
164   * @param name The name to use for our check.
165   * @return True if a plugin with that name exists, otherwise false.
166   */
167  default boolean pluginAvailable(final String name) {
168    return false;
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Used to replace colour codes in a string.
173   * @param string The string to format.
174   * @param strip If true, the color codes are striped from the string.
175   * @return The formatted string.
176   */
177  String replaceColours(final String string, boolean strip);
178
179  /**
180   * Provides direct access to the implementation's instance of TNIL's AbstractItemStack, which acts
181   * as a builder.
182   * @return The software's implementation of {@link AbstractItemStack}.
183   */
184  AbstractItemStack<?> stackBuilder();
185
186  /**
187   * Used to save a resource from the plugin's jar file to the local system's storage.
188   * @param path The path to the resource inside the jar.
189   * @param replace If the file exists in the local system's storage, should it be replaced?
190   */
191  void saveResource(final String path, final boolean replace);
192
193  /**
194   * Retrieves an input stream for the specified filename from the resources.
195   *
196   * @param filename The name of the file to retrieve from the resources. Cannot be null.
197   * @return An input stream for the specified file, or null if the file is not found in the resources.
198   */
199  @Nullable InputStream getResource(@NotNull String filename);
200
201  /**
202   * Provides this implementation's {@link SchedulerProvider scheduler}.
203   * @return The scheduler for this implementation.
204   */
205  SchedulerProvider<?> scheduler();
206
207  /**
208   * Used to register a crafting recipe to the server.
209   *
210   * @param key The key for the crafting recipe to be registered.
211   * @param recipe The crafting recipe to register.
212   * @see CraftingRecipe
213   */
214  void registerCrafting(@NotNull final String key, @NotNull final CraftingRecipe recipe);
215
216  <S, T extends AbstractItemStack<S>, INV> CalculationsProvider<T, S, INV> calculations();
217}
